feed.title: SAP Community - SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central
feed.subtitle: SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Enhancement Request: Duplicate Workflow Approvers
entry.content:
Please vote. 

Our company has a robust workflow approval process that often includes multiple layers of leadership—VP, SVP, EVP—as well as HR Business Partners. In some cases, the same individual may appear in multiple approval roles (e.g., as both the direct manager and the VP), resulting in redundant approvals for the same position change.

https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/idea/356979

Proposal: Enhance the workflow logic to detect when an approver is already included in a previous step of the approval chain and automatically skip duplicate approvals for that individual.

Example Scenario:
A salaried position change requires approvals from:

  • Manager
  • Manager +1
  • VP
  • Executive
  • HRBP

If Adam is both the Manager and the VP, and Veronica is both Manager +1 and the Executive approver, the system should recognize these overlaps and skip redundant approvals.

entry.title: Mapping Attachment Fields from Onboarding to Employee Central
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I’m reaching out because I need to map attachment fields from the Provide Additional Data step in the onboarding process (or in general from onboarding, because I see for example that the ID Card attachment is mapped by default) to Employee Central.

According to this guide Configurable New Hire for Onboarding, it seems possible to map data fields using the New Hire Template.

However, I’m wondering if it’s also possible to map the attachment files themselves, or if the mapping is limited to data fields only.

And if it's not possible, can you suggest a workaround?

Thank you in advance for your insights!

entry.title: How can I run a report in Report Center to track changes in desired fields (FO or custom)
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I’d like to build a report in Report Center that shows only the changes to specific fields, for example an employee’s Business Unit or Department. I do not want to list all job information transactions (every effective-dated change). Ideally, my table would look like this:

 

User IDStart DateEnd DateBusiness UnitDepartment
101-01-202504-03-2025BU1D1
104-04-202531-12-9999BU2D3

Questions:

  • Is there a way to configure this in Table (Ad Hoc) Reports, Advanced Reporting, or People Analytics so that only changes to the selected field are displayed? 
  • If the answer is YES - will I be able to replicate this behavior when pulling data via the API?

Currently, I`m pulling the data from the the Global Job Info, I selected in Date Options "Show All" and of course, I`m getting ALL TIME transactions, so something like the below... This is because the rows in red correspond to a different event. 

 

User IDStart DateEnd DateBusiness UnitDepartment
101-01-202504-03-2025BU1D1
101-01-202504-03-2025BU1D1
101-01-202504-03-2025BU1D1
101-01-202504-03-2025BU1D1
104-04-202531-12-9999BU2D3

Any guidance or examples would be appreciated!

Thank you.

entry.title: 'Select All Fields' option in Story Report
entry.content:
Currently, while creating a story report, there is no option to select ALL fields in the 'Add Dimensions' option for both the Rows & Columns sections. All the fields that we add from the Data Source need to be selected individually at the 'Add Dimensions' section, only then the respective field reflects in the report.

There should be an option as 'SELECT ALL FIELDS' in the top-most column at the field selection list in the 'Add Dimensions' section. This would help all the people who work on Story reports & enhance the user experience.

I have submitted an enhancement request for this functionality. Please cast your vote if you feel this would help the users.

https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/idea/357089

 

Regards,

Anvesh

entry.title: Help Needed with Accrual Rule for India – Probation Period Handling
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community, 

I need support with an accrual rule for India, where the probation period end date should be considered in the accrual logic.

Business scenario:

  • During the probation period, employees do not receive any Privilege Leave.

  • After the end of probation, employees are entitled to 1.25 days of Privilege Leave per month.

  • The confirmation of probation can occur on any day within the month.

Example:
An employee joins on 05.05.2024, and the probation period ends on 06.05.2025.
In this case, May 2025 should be included in the accrual calculation, since the confirmation occurs within the same month.

Current issue:

  • The current business rule excludes the probation confirmation month and begins accrual from the following month (e.g. from June in the above example).

  • After testing and some adjustments, we found that the rule only works correctly if the Job Information record starts on the 1st of the month or before the confirmation date.

    • In that case, the confirmation month is correctly included in the accrual calculation.

Question:

Is there any way to include the probation confirmation month in the accrual logic even if the confirmation date is not on the 1st of the month? Can this be achieved by configuring the business rule differently or by using a workaround?

Any insights or suggestions would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you and best reagrds

Thiphawan

entry.title: How can I use the RIGHT or LEFT functions inside an IF statement in Story query?
entry.content:
I am in the middle of an implementation which involves migrating data from an existing HRIS.

Context: In the existing HRIS, employee IDs are 5 digits, e.g. 1234. To migrate to EC, we are adding 100 as a prefix, or 1000 to those under 5 digits. In EC, new users will have an ID starting with 2000000.

Issue: I am trying to create a story report to use as an export into our document management system. I want to be able to truncate the ID of existing users, which I can manage fine with the RIGHT function. However, I won't want it to do this for new IDs. I am struggling to use IF statement conditions/formula to specify this. Can anyone help me to format it?

As an example, if this were an Excel query, it would look like this:

entry.title: Difficulty Triggering Workflow in SuccessFactors When Data Is Auto-Posted from BTP
entry.content:
Hi All,

I’m working on an integration where contract end data is auto-posted from SAP BTP to SuccessFactors (SF) . The data is being posted into the Resignation portlet, and I want to trigger a workflow in SF when this happens. But, the workflow is not getting triggered when the data is posted from BTP. 

Thanks,
Sakshi

Please help!

entry.title: Pay Range in Job Requisition
entry.content:
We are looking to map the Pay Range in EC to the Job Requisition fields, but we are facing a challenge due to the fact that the pay ranges have different minimum, maximum, and midpoint values. Also, this pay ranges is not maintained in position, hence we need to create a basic rule. Below is an example of the pay ranges we are working with:

Example Pay Ranges:

Pay Range ID: Pay Range 1

  • Minimum Pay 1: 43,200
  • Maximum Pay 1: 64,800
  • Mid Point 1: 54,000
  • Minimum Pay 2: 44,800
  • Maximum Pay 2: 67,200
  • Mid Point 2: 56,000
  • Minimum Pay 3: 44,800
  • Maximum Pay 3: 67,200
  • Mid Point 3: 56,000

Expected Mapping in Job Requisition:

When a recruiter selects a specific Pay Range ID in the Job Requisition, the following fields should be mapped as follows:

If Pay Range 1 is selected:

  • ABS Min: Should be equal to Minimum Pay 1 (43,200)
  • ABS Median: Should be equal to Mid Point Pay 1 (54,000)
  • ABS Max: Should be equal to Maximum Pay 1 (64,800)
  • TTC Min: Should be equal to Minimum Pay 2 (44,800)
  • TTC Median: Should be equal to Mid Point Pay 2 (56,000)
  • TTC Max: Should be equal to Maximum Pay 2 (67,200)
  • TDC Min: Should be equal to Minimum Pay 3 (44,800)
  • TDC Median: Should be equal to Mid Point Pay 3 (56,000)
  • TDC Max: Should be equal to Maximum Pay 3 (67,200)

Question:

Is it possible to implement this mapping dynamically using a rule in EC? Specifically, we want the rule to be easy to maintain and automatically update whenever the Pay Range in EC changes. This would prevent the need for manually updating the rule in the requisition each time the Pay Ranges are updated.

If this is feasible, could you please provide guidance on how to configure such a rule?

Your assistance would be greatly appreciated!

entry.title: Job Profile Builder - Position Selection
entry.content:
Hello Experts

I identified that enabling the Job Profile Builder activated two new objects: Family and Role.

Through the Job Profile Builder, we created the links between Family > Role > Job Code.

However, the client is requesting that during position creation, the Job Code should be selectable based on the configuration we have in the Job Profile Builder.

Example:
Family: Human Resources
Role: HR Generalist
Job Code: HR Analyst I

However, this is not working as expected — it seems that the Job Profile Builder operates separately and does not have any direct correlation with the Position object. I also tried to create associations between Family – Role – Job Code, but it’s still not working as intended.

Here’s an example below:

entry.title: How to report on planned working days per month?
entry.content:
Hi experts,

I am trying to build a story report that would give me information on planned working days per month for every employee based on their work schedule and holiday calendar. So for October I have 23 work days, but other employee with different holiday calendar will have 21. We are using time off and basic time sheet. 

Could you please  support me on that?

Thank you in advance,

Gosia

entry.content:

① Does this upgrade not apply to the “Attribute Type” list screen that appears first when accessing the Growth Portfolio?
In other words, will filtering and sorting not be implemented on the “Attribute Type” list screen?
 the “Attribute Type” list screen is as follows.



② Is it possible for administrators to set the default sort order (i.e., the order before users apply their own sort settings)?
If not, what would the default sort order be (e.g., ascending by Name)?

Our clients have a strong interest in the display order of attributes within the growth portfolio, so we would like to ask you about this.

Best regards,

entry.content:

entry.title: Event trigger on post save, when LOA is entered in Job information portlet
entry.content:
Hello!

We have a requirement to trigger an ISC event whenever a Leave of Absence (LOA) or Return to Work (RTW) entry is made in the Job Information portlet.

Currently, the Leave Admin enters the LOA on behalf of the employee, which immediately sets the leave request to an Approved status. Because the request does not transition from Pending to Approved, the business rule is not triggered as expected.

Here’s a breakdown of the process:

  1. Leave Admin enters the LOA directly for the employee, setting the request to Approved.
  2. This action creates an LOA event in the Job Information portlet.
  3. Expected Behavior: A business rule should trigger on the post-save event based on changes in the Job Information model.
  4. Expected Outcome: The business rule should initiate an ISC event.
  5. Once triggered, the ISC event should send the required data to CPI via Integration Center.

Challenge: Since the LOA is entered directly in an approved state, the usual status transition that triggers the business rule does not occur.

Do you have any suggestions or workarounds to ensure the business rule and ISC event are triggered correctly in this scenario?

Any inputs or suggestions are greatly appreciated!

-Swathi

entry.title: How to make a pay scale level inactive.
entry.content: I am trying to make a pay scale level inactive, buy there is no option to do so in Manage data. I tried to make a correction, but there is no option to change it to have an end date. I do not want to delete the level for historical purposes.
